Bhop PRO: Jumping or a nervous breakdown? *(6.5/10)*

What's annoying:

Character physics - like controlling a ball of mercury on a hot frying pan

The first two hours - nothing but falls, swearing, and the desire to delete the game

Jumping over gaps - 90% of the times you fail feels like a clear bug, not a "skill issue"

What's catchy (if you survive the adaptation period):
âœ” The thrill of completing a difficult section perfectly
âœ” The pleasure of watching other players suffer too
âœ” Decent replayability for fans of the genre

A special "thanks" to the developers for:

The complete lack of a clear tutorial

The ingenious system where 1mm of missing the target = death and the start of a chapter

It feels like the game hates you personally

Overall: 3/10 - you'll either love it after 10 hours of torment, or hate it forever after 20 minutes.

P.S. Tip: Before the game, take a sedative, turn off the microphone, and prepare a screaming pillow.

Since there were no reviews in Japanese, I'll write this for reference.
First of all, to anyone reading this who's considering buying this game even though it's not on sale (I doubt there are),
You shouldn't buy it. I bought it on sale for 100 yen.
Apparently this game is a port from a mobile game, and I've seen reviews saying that the characters moved quite quickly in the mobile version, but are too slow here. [u] Actually, there's a trick? A bug? for increasing speed in this game. When you normally use a vanilla hob, the velocity in the bottom right only goes up to 500, but if you swing your view to the right or left while using a vanilla hob, your speed will increase rapidly. I can't say anything negative yet, so we're looking forward to progress.
